intro: Castanea pumila var. ozarkensis, commonly known as the Ozark chestnut, is a small deciduous shrub or tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by spiny, cup-shaped fruits containing one or two edible nuts. It is adapted to moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland areas and streamside habitats.
